text: Fujisawa (藤沢市, Fujisawa-shi) is a Japanese city in Kanagawa Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Fujisawa, Kanagawa" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 199. ==History== In the Edo period, Fujisawa-shuku was 6th of the 53 shogunate-maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, "Tōkaidō" at p. 973. The area of the city expanded around Yugyō-ji temple (遊行寺) after 1325. ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.fujisawa.kanagawa.jp/introduce/english/ ; Category:Cities in Kanagawa Prefecture
title: Fujisawa, Kanagawa
